item.name: gateway/{gwid}/api/v1/ontology
Ontology
property
device
Get the fieldbus devices of the property

request.description:
The devices are the equipment on the fieldbus network that are controlling actuators and sensors.

This resource path retrieves the list of physical fieldbus devices that are defined within the property

response.name: List of fieldbus devices within the project

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the detail of a fieldbus device

request.description:
The devices are the equipment on the fieldbus network that are controlling actuators and sensors.

This resource path retrieves the detail of a physical fieldbus device

response.name: Detail information of the fieldbus device

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the property of the project

request.description: This resource path retrieves the property object hich is the root object in the ontology of the openBos hierarchy

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: building
Get the buildings defined in the project

query.description:
Contains search pattern to produce the list. If no set all items will be returned.

Filter can look like :
    Name contains "A"
    Name = "A"
    Name startswith "A"
    Name endswith "A"
    Tags contains "A"

And/Or can be used to generate complex query like : (Tags contains "A")or(Name endswith "r")

request.description: Get the buildings defined in the project

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the detailed information of a building

request.description:
Detail information of building will contain information that will allow to traverse the hierarchy of the building.
ie: you can follow to the next structure by using the retrieved parameter "structureChildren" within the result object.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: space
Returns the spaces defined in the project

query.description: Type of space that are filtered. Possible type of space can be found in the list of possible tags in documentation.
Filter criteria to limit the retrieved items (ie: Name contains "ABC" and Tags contains "meeting")

request.description:
A space can be for example a meeting room, an office, a cafeteria a corridor
It is a space with a specific function within the building

This routes return all the spaces defined in the project. Meaning the generic zone with a tag $$space.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Returns a specific space defined in the project

query.description: Type of space that are filtered. Possible type of space can be found in the list of possible tags in documentation.

request.description:
A space can be for example a meeting room, an office, a cafeteria a corridor
It is a space with a specific function within the building

This routes return the detail information of a space defined in the project.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: structure
Get the list of structures defined in the project

query.description: Filter criteria on the queried type of structure
Filter criteria to limit the retrieved items (ie: Name contains "ABC" and Tags contains "meeting")

request.description:
A structure can be a floor, roof, facade, something that is fixed within a building.

This resource path retrieves the list of structure elements in the project.

response.name: List of basic information on structures matching the filters

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the detail information of a specific structure of the project

request.description:
A structure can be a floor, roof, facade, something that is fixed within a building.

This resource path retrieves the detail information of a structure. The detail information contains parameters that can be used to traverse the hierarachy.
ie: parameter "spaceChildren" will contain the resource path to follow to get the list of spaces that are defined inside a specific struture.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: area
Get the logical areas defined in the project

query.description: Type of area that are filtered. Possible type of space can be found in the list of available tags in the documentation.
Filter criteria to limit the retrieved items (ie: Name contains "ABC" and Tags contains "meeting")

request.description:
An area can be for example a central HVAC area, with its related asset + the spaces that are supplied by this central HVAC asset
It has no "physical" meaning it is a grouping of several spaces

This routes return all the areas defined in the project

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get an area defined in the project

request.description:
An area can be for example a central HVAC area, with its related asset + the spaces that are supplied by this central HVAC asset
It has no "physical" meaning it is a grouping of several spaces

This routes return detail information of one areas defined in the project

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: zone
Returns the list of zones in the project in a generic way

query.description:
Contains search pattern to produce the list. If no set all items will be returned.

Filter can look like :
    Name contains "A"
    Name = "A"
    Name startswith "A"
    Name endswith "A"
    Tags contains "A"

And/Or can be used to generate complex query like : (Tags contains "A")or(Name endswith "r")

request.description:
All ontology property, building, structure, space, area are considered as generic zone in openBOS
This resource path allows to query the whole zone concept in a generic manner.

response.name: List of zone instances matching the filter criteria

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Find the parents of a certain type for a building, structure, space, area or generic zone inside the roject

query.description: type of parents

Contains search pattern to produce the list. If no set all items will be returned.

Filter can look like :
    Name contains "A"
    Name = "A"
    Name startswith "A"
    Name endswith "A"
    Tags contains "A"

And/Or can be used to generate complex query like : (Tags contains "A")or(Name endswith "r")

request.description: If working on a space and asking for parent of type building, the result will be the building of the space.

response.name: List of parents of any property zone matching type of zone

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: returns the children of any property zone instance filtering on the type of the children

query.description: type of children

Contains search pattern to produce the list. If no set all items will be returned.

Filter can look like :
    Name contains "A"
    Name = "A"
    Name startswith "A"
    Name endswith "A"
    Tags contains "A"

And/Or can be used to generate complex query like : (Tags contains "A")or(Name endswith "r")

request.description: returns the children of any property zone instance filtering on the type of the children

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Returns the detail information of a generic zone

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the zone instance

request.description:
All ontology property, building, structure, space, area are considered as generic zone in openBOS
This resource path allows to query detail of a generic zone.

The difference with the data retrieved via property, space, area from ontology is that generic zone will not contain the ontology decorator like the resource path to get the children space or to get the alarms

response.name: List of zone instances matching the filter criteria

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: physicaldevice
/gateway/{gwid}/api/v1/ontology/physicaldevice - GET

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get a physical device detail by id

request.description: Get a physical device detail by id

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: deviceinstance
Get the list of device instance available in the system

query.description: Id of the network you want the devices. null for all

request.description: Get the list of device instance available in the system

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get a device instance detail by id

request.description: Get a device instance detail by id

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: functionalblock
Get a list of functional block instance available in the system

query.description: Filter criteria to limit the retrieved items (ie: Name contains "ABC" and Tags contains "meeting")

request.description: Logged user must have a correct job mask and have access to at least one parent zone of the functional block

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get an existing functional block instance detail

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the functional block instance object

request.description: Logged user must have a correct job mask and have access to at least one parent zone of the functional block

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: datapoint
datatype
Get the list of available data type present in the entire project

request.description:
Each value has a datatype including unit, min, max, limit, possible value if any...
That resource path returns the catalogue of the entire datatypes available in the project depening on the transport in the edge (the protocols).
Detailled information on a datatype can be found by using the datatype resource path including its unique id (ie: .../datatype/{id} )

response.name: Retrieves the list of data type basics information

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the list of available data type for a given transport

query.description: The filtered transport for datatypes

request.description:
A transport is a protocol. That resource path returns the list of available datatypes in a network.
You can state the network you want giving the correct protocol as a parameter
(BACnet, KNXRouting, KNXTunneling, Lonworks, ModbusSerial, ModbusIP, MBus, xDriver, Memory)

response.name: Retrieves the list of data type basics information matching transport criteria

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the detail of a DataType of the project.

query.description: Id of the desired unit for numeric min/max. If not present will use the unit of the datatype

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the data type object

request.description:
A DataType can be of type Long, Double, Bool, String, Enumeration, Complex, DateTime, Duration, IP address, IP address + port, Byte, Array Of one of preceding dataType.
That resource path needs the ID of the datatype and returns the details
Detail of a dataType may for example gives the autorized min / max value of a Long or Double value or give the list of valid enumeration.

response.name: Detailled information of a specific datatype.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

response.body:
{
 "type": "occaecat",
 "tag": "pariatur sint exercitation laboris",
 "id": "et est cillum laboris",
 "transport": "MBus",
 "name": "anim ullamco"
}

item.name: unit
List of units available in openBOS

request.description:
openBOS offers predefined unit for interoperability reasons. That resource path sends back the units managed by openBOS.
For more information on a unit use the unit resource path with the ID of the unit.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the detail of a specific unit.

request.description: Get the detail of a specific unit defined by its ID: name, esolution, category, prefered min and prefered max

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: perform a convertion between 2 units

request.description:
Units may not be one to one compatible and you may need to perform a conversion to move from unit 1 to unit 2.
That resource path may be used to perform that action.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get a list of datapoint instances for a given datapoint template Id

variable.description: (Required) the id of the Datapoint Template

request.description: Logged user must have a correct job mask and have access to at least one parent zone of the functional block of the datapoint

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get an existing datapoint instance

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the data point

request.description: Get an existing datapoint instance

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get a list of all tags

request.description: Get a list of all tags

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: File resources of ontology

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Templates
devicetemplate
Get the device templates defined in the project

query.description: Filter criteria to limit the retrieved device template to a specific protocol driver

request.description:
Device template is the description of a model of a manufacturer device, including its protocol arguments with list of Functional Blocks, DataPoints.


This resource path returns the list of device template.

response.name: Basics information of matching device templates

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get a detail information of a device template

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the requested device template

request.description:
Device template is the description of a model of a manufacturer device, including its protcol arguments with list of Functional Blocks, DataPoints.


This resource path return the detail information of a device template

response.name: Successfully retrieves the device template detail

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: zonetemplate
Get the zone templates defined in the project

query.description: Filter criteria to limit the retrieved zone template (ie: Name contains "ABC" and Tags contains "meeting")

request.description:
All zones in the openBOS are based on a zone template. A zone template defines the list of functional block that can be present in the zone, as the list of datapoint that are directly present in the zone.


This resource path returns the list of zone templates available in the project.

response.name: Basics information of matching zone templates

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the detail of a zone template defined in the project

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the requested zone template

request.description:
All zones in the openBOS are based on a zone template. A zone template defines the list of functional block that can be present in the zone, as the list of datapoint that are directly present in the zone.


This resource path returns detail of a specific zone template.

response.name: Basics information of matching zone templates

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: functionalblocktemplate
Get the list of asset's template in the project

query.description:
Contains search pattern to produce the list. If no set all items will be returned.

Filter can look like :
    Name contains "A"
    Name = "A"
    Name startswith "A"
    Name endswith "A"
    Tags contains "A"

And/Or can be used to generate complex query like : (Tags contains "A")or(Name endswith "r")

request.description:
openBOS manages assets in the building (lamp, button, fancoil, ...).
Every asset refer to a template and are all instances of an asset template. (i.e. Each lamp is an instance of a lamp template.)
That resource path returns the complete list of asset template in the building.
From here you retrieve only the basic information of each template.
To collect the detailed information on a specific asset template you will need to use the dedicated endpoint by using the unique identifier of the entity (/api/v1/ontology/{entity}/{id}).

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the detail of an asset template of the project

request.description:
openBOS manages assets in the building (lamp, button, fancoil, ...).
Every asset refer to a template and are all instances of an asset template. (i.e. Each lamp is an instance of a lamp template.)
Here retrieve the detailed information of an asset template by its unique identifier.
The detail will give information like possible configuration values that you will find on the asset instances that are based on the current asset template.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Users
user
Returns users of a certain type for a certain property zone

query.description: Type of requested users
Id of the parent property zone

request.description:
This resource path retrieves the basics information of users matching a criteria.
openBOS offers several type of users and you may have differences in roles, agreements, between these types of users.
We are managing: Tenant, Owner, PropertyManager, FacilityManager, Visitor and Administrator.

Connected user must have at least CanConfigureUser access right to retrieve more users than himself.

response.name: List of basics information of users matching the criteria.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get detail of a specific user

request.description:
This resource path retrieves detailed information of a user identified by its unique identifier


openBOS offers several type of users having different roles, agreements, between these types of users. Connected user must have at least CanConfigureUser access right and same root role as the requested user to use this method on a user different than himself.

response.name: Retrieve detailed information of found users.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: role
Get the roles available in the project

query.description:
Contains search pattern to produce the list. If no set all roles will be returned.

Filter can look like :
    Name contains "A"
    Name = "A"
    Name startswith "A"
    Name endswith "A"
    Tags contains "A"

And/Or can be used to generate complex query like : (Tags contains "A")or(Name endswith "r")

request.description:
This resource path retrieves the list of roles a user can be assigned to.

openBOS uses a Role Based Access Control system. Each user can be assigned to one or several Role. Each role being configured with access rights and topology accessibility (limit to certain zones)

response.name: List of roles matching the filter criteria.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get a specific role

variable.description: (Required) Unique id of the requested role

request.description:
This resource path retrieves a specific role by its unique identifier.

openBOS uses a Role Based Access Control system. Each user can be assigned to one or several Role. Each role being configured with access rights and topology accessibility (limit to certain zones)

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: jobmask
Get the list of the jobmasks in the project.

request.description:
This resource path retrieves the list of jobmasks inside the project.


Users have jobmasks meaning a family of users they belong. Objects may or may not be available depending on jobmasks parameters.
For example with a jobmask Electrical Installer you may not access to the HVAC components.


Jobmasks descriptions are defined by administrator in openBOS.
For more information on the jobmask use the resource path jobmask with the ID of the jobMask

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get detailled information on a specific jobmask

request.description:
This resource path retrieves detailled information on a specific jobmask.


Users have jobmasks meaning a family of users they belong. Objects may or may not be available depending on jobmasks parameters.
For example with a jobmask Electrical Installer you may not access to the HVAC components.
Jobmasks descriptions are defined by administrator in openBOS.

response.name: The detailled information of the jobmask

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get all available access rights

request.description:
This resource path retrieves the list of access right that can be set to a role in an openBOS project
openBOS uses a role base access control system.
Each user being linked to role, each role having permissions.
The access rights are one of these possible permissions authorized for a role.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Trends and Alarms
alarmtemplate
Get the list of alarm templates in the project

request.description:
An alarm template is used to create several alarm instances that will have the same behaviour on a set of DataPointInstance
The alarm template describes the alarm triggers, and the selection of DataPoint on which the alarm template will applied
The selection of datapointinstance can be a manual selection of individual datapointinstance or all datapoint instances matching a datapoint template inside a zone or functional block


This resource path returns the list of alarm templates that are configured within the project

response.name: Retrieves the list of alarm template basics information

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Add a new subscription for live alarm notification

request.description:
We propose an event driven mechanism to access the data changes. Instead of continuously reading a data you may subscribe to a value change.
That resource path is used to subscribe to an alarms of openBOS when it is triggered.
As soon as client has subscribed he will be able to receive the state change of alarms inside openBOS.

Include the closest value just after before "from" and just after "to" criterias

item.name: Edges and Fieldbuses
station
{id}
Get detailled information for a specific station

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the requested middleware station

request.description:
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.
That resource path returns the detailled information of a specific station in the project.

response.name: Retrieve detailled definition of the middleware station

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the list of available protocol driver in a specific Station

request.description:
A station is a hardware embeding at least a middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): The networks.
That resource path sends back the entire protocols supported by the Station . That may be used to read data from fieldbus.
For more information on a driver use the resource path .../station/{stationId}/driver/get/{id} with the ID of the driver.

response.name: List of protocol driver definitions on the station.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the list of stations inside the project

request.description:
This resource path retrieves the basics information of station defined in the project.
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.
Detailled information on a station can be found by using station resource path including its unique id (ie: .../station/{id} )

response.name: Retrieve the list of station in the system with for each the basics information

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Forces an operation of synchronization on a specific station

request.description:
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.


The synchronization is the operation of keeping in sync the openBOS and its underlying middleware.
Each time an update is done on openBOS that has impact on the middleware layer (used to communicate with fieldbus devices) a synchronization is required to align both definition.


That routes forces an operation of synchronization on a specific station.

response.name: Retrieves the unique identifier of the operation (tag). This tag must be passed, later on, to the synchronization status resource path to get the advancement of the operation.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the detail of a specific protocol driver on a station

request.description:
A station is a hardware embeding at least a middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols. Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each fieldbus is accessible through a dedicated driver, this command retrieve the detail of a driver.
The driver detail contains the list of configuration values used to communicate with the fieldbus device of the protocol.
The list of configuration is dependant from the driver itself (ie: the configuration used for a ModBus communication is different from the configuration used for a BACNet communication.

response.name: Protocol driver definitions on the station.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: projectsettings
Get the project settings

request.description:
Get the project settings of openBOS
Settings include name, details, language, supported languages, device synchronisation status, interval of synchronization with Cloud,

response.name: Returns the object containing project settings

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Put the project settings

request.description:
Update the project settings of openBOS
Settings include name, details, language, supported languages, device synchronisation status, interval of synchronization with Cloud,

response.name: Indicates the project settings has been successfuly updated

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'
(Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: network
{id}
organization
Get the database of devices and parameters of a network

query.description: null to get the root branches, otherwise parent id of the branch to get its children

request.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least one middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each network includes a collection of devices, infrastructure, has a list of parameters, a list of datapoints, [...]: we call it the network organisation.
The network organisation is built has a standard hierarchic tree.
The exploration of an organization is done level by level by requesting the children .
This resource path retrieves a level in the hierarchic tree of the network organisation

response.name: Retrieves the branches matching parentId criteria

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the version number of the database of devices and parameters of a network

request.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least one middleware.That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each network includes a collection of devices, infrastructure, has a list of parameters, a list of datapoints, [...]: we call it the network organisation.
This resource path retrieves the internal version of the network organisation in the database (each update of the network organisation increase this version number)

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get detail information of a specific network of a station.

request.description:
A station is a hardware embeding at least a middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
That resource path gives the details of the specific network giving its unique identifier as parameter.

response.name: Detail information of a specific network.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the list of field bus networks available in the whole project.

request.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least a middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
A fieldbus network is a declared network of devices communicating on a protocol.
We may have for example LonWorks, BACnet, KNX, MQTT network That resource path returns the collection of available networks in a station.


For detailled on a network use the dedicated network resource path with the ID of the network (.../network/{id})

response.name: List of basics definition of network insied the project.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: stationsynchrostatus
{station Id}
Get the synchronization "in-progress" flag for a station.

request.description:
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.
The synchronization is the operation of keeping in sync the openBOS and its underlying middleware.
Each time an update is done on openBOS that has impact on the middleware layer (used to communicate with fieldbus devices) a synchronization is required to align both definition.
Each station can be configured to synchronize manually or automaticaly.
That routes retrieves a flag indicating if a synchronization is in progress on a specific station (specified by iyts id).

response.name: Retrieves a boolean indicating if a synchronization is in progress

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the status of synchronization of a specific station.

variable.description: (Required) tag returned by a forced synchronization

request.description:
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.


The synchronization is the operation of keeping in sync the openBOS and its underlying middleware.
Each time an update is done on openBOS that has impact on the middleware layer (used to communicate with fieldbus devices) a synchronization is required to align both definition.
Each station can be configured to synchronize manually or automaticaly.
That routes retrieves the status of a specific forced synchronization (specified by a tag) on a specific station (specified by its id).

response.name: Retrieves a boolean indicating if the synchronization is done

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Get the status of synchronization of the stations inside the project

request.description:
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.


The synchronization is the operation of keeping in sync the openBOS and its underlying middleware.
Each time an update is done on openBOS that has impact on the middleware layer (used to communicate with fieldbus devices) a synchronization is required to align both definition.
Synchronization can be set manual or automatic for each station.


That routes retrieves the synchronization status for all the stations of the project.

response.name: Retrieves synchronization status of middleware stations

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: LiveData
datapointinstance/livedata
fbsystem
Read the System parameters of the Edge

request.description:
Each edge has several system parameters (Hour, IP configuration, SNTP Config,...). Each individual parameter has an ID.
Here you read the individual parameter that are live data and not database data.You select it with its ID.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Write the value of datapoints

request.description:
Each edge has several system parameters (Hour, IP configuration, SNTP Config,...). Each individual parameter has an ID.
Here you may write one individual parameter that is a live data parameter and not database data parameter. You select it with its ID and give new value.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Read value from a sensor

query.description: Id of the datapoints to read
Id of the datapoints to read

request.description:
A datapoint Instance is a variable of a sensor or actuator.
With that resource path you read the value of a sensor from the network knowing the ID of the datapoint.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Write value to an actuator

request.description:
A datapoint Instance is a variable of a sensor or actuator.
With that resource path you force an output of an actuator with a value knowing the ID of the datapoint.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: datapointsubscription
{id}
Update parameters of an existing subscription in the system.

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the subscription to update

request.description: Every subscription have an ID. With that resource path you may change one or all the parameters of that subscription

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Delete an existing subscription in the system.

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the subscription to delete

request.description: Delete an existing subscription in the system. Need to knwo the ID of the subscription

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Create a subscription to receive datapoint value change notifications.

request.description:
We propose an event driven mechanism to access to data change. Instead of continuously reading a data you may subscribe to a value change.
You need to give the ID of the datapoints, the parameters of automatic scanning for the dataserver engine in the edge and the WebHook parameters

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: MapView
Returns the mapview definition of a structure

query.description: Unique identifier of the structure for which the mapview is requested

request.description:
The mapview is the graphical representation of a structure in 2D including its spaces and areas.

This resource path returns the mapview definition (zoom, tiles). To get the coordinates of the spaces and area you must make a subsequent call to .../mapview/{id}/graphics wher {id} is the id in the definition object returned here

response.name: The object definition of the mapview.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Returns the coordinates of all the items present in the mapview

request.description:
The mapview is the graphical representation of a structure in 2D including its spaces and areas.

This resource path returns the coordinates of the spaces (MapViewElementZoneDTO), areas (MapViewElementZoneDTO), functionalblock (MapViewElementFBDTO), text (MapViewElementTextDTO), images (MapViewElementImageDTO) that have been put on the mapview.

response.name: The object definition of mapview items and their coordinates.

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'

item.name: Executes several queries into a single batch command

request.description:
Allows to get in a single call several requests executed on the server.
Can be very useful when many information from different entities need to be collected at a time.
For example retrieve detailed information of all the assets of a single zone in one shot.

response.name: List of result code and result content of each query from the batch

header.description: (Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'
(Required) The AAD JWT token that contains credentials to authenticate the user. Example: 'Bearer 12345abcdef'
